citation.article-title: Aquitalea magnusonii gen. nov., sp. nov., a novel Gram-negative bacterium isolated from a humic lake
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Aquitalea (A.qui.ta′le.a. L. fem. n. aqua -ae, water; L. fem. n. talea -ae a slender staff, rod, stick; N.L. fem. n. Aquitalea a rod of water).
Cells are Gram-negative, non-spore-forming, short rods.
Rods are straight or slightly curved and 1–7 μm in length.
Strain is aerobic, facultatively anaerobic, chemoheterotrophic and sensitive to NaCl.
Cells are motile with one polar flagellum and are catalase- and oxidase-positive.
Predominant fatty acids are C16 : 1ω7c (53 %) and C16 : 0 (22 %), C18 : 1ω7c (8 %) and C12 : 0 (5 %).
Phylogenetically belongs to the family Neisseriaceae.
The type species is Aquitalea magnusonii.
